title: New Norcia. New Norcia voices (A)
viewing_guidelines: Aboriginal and Islander viewers should note this work may contain images of deceased people and caution should be exercised when viewing.
subject_group: Aboriginal Australia/Benedictine Abbey of New Norcia, Western Australia - History
History/Benedictine Abbey of New Norcia, Western Australia - History
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Culture conflict
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Monks - Australia
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Monasteries - Australia
description: A compilation of two companion films. 'New Norcia' (23 mins. 1990) is a representation through images and journal extracts of the history of contact between European and Aboriginal cultures, circa 1850-1900 at the Benedictine Mission at New Norcia in Western Australia. 'New Norcia Voices' (19 mins. 1992) combines interviews with a monk at the monastery, historians, and men and women who were brought-up at the mission. Each brings a different perspective to the legend of the founder Bishop Salvado, the legacy of the Mission and what this might mean today.'New Norcia' narrated by Ian Taylor.
